newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SRI LANKA RETENDERS TO BUY SEPT DIESEL/JET FUEL.
newsitem.headline: SRI LANKA RETENDERS TO BUY SEPT DIESEL/JET FUEL.

text.p: State-owned Ceylon Petroleum Corp (CPC) has on Wednesday re-issued a tender to buy jet fuel and diesel for slightly later dates in September after cancelling a tender earlier this week, a company official said.
"We have re-issued the tender..because we wanted to delay the delivery," the official said.
On Tuesday, CPC cancelled its tender for middle-distillate supplies for delivery on September 3-4 amid high stocks as power stations are using more hydropower for generation amid the heavy rains.
The new tender, which seeks deliveries during September 9-10, closes August 20 and is valid for two days.
CPC seeks the same volume of 250,000 barrels of 1.0 percent diesel as in its original tender but has raised the jet A-1 volume to 40,000 barrels from 25,000 barrels, the official said.

In its last tender for August 11-12 delivery, CPC bought 250,000 barrels of 1.0-percent sulphur diesel from Swiss trader Glencore at a 68-cent-per-barrel premium to Singapore spot quotes, c-and-f Colombo.
